name: TheAtlantic
text: Teens fared better than expected during this year's quarantine, in part because because they got more sleep and family time, writes @jean_twenge. https://t.co/u7ECx4ykTa

name: TheAtlantic
text: Teens fared better than expected during this year's quarantine, in part because they got more sleep and family time, writes @jean_twenge. https://t.co/tJXlir7c8t

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The identity of Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg’s successor is now in the forefront of the news … [But] the American people must not lose sight of the entirety of the federal judiciary," writes Judge Noël Wise: https://t.co/pg3EJ9bkSn

name: TheAtlantic
text: Nikon has announced the winners of the 2020 Small World Photomicrography Competition, which invites photographers and scientists to submit images of all things visible under a microscope—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/Valmb4VBju

name: TheAtlantic
text: Nikon has announced the winners of the 2020 Small World Photomicrography Competition, which invites photographers and scientists to submit images of all things visible under a microscope—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/BZFGqpMiyo

name: TheAtlantic
text: Endia Beal’s photographs explore how race, gender, and work intersect, with a particular focus on the lives of Black women, @imaniperry writes. https://t.co/cq8eKw0YHR

name: TheAtlantic
text: If intellectual meandering is key to real learning, why not embrace distraction—even in class? @lilyjmeyer considers the pandemic-era lecture: https://t.co/iqEJc3qzyA

name: TheAtlantic
text: Meet the Milk Tea Alliance, the very online grouping that is emblematic of the frustration many young people feel toward Beijing’s grating assertiveness in Asia. @TMcLaughlin3 reports: https://t.co/NQ8Ht4DhaN

name: TheAtlantic
text: Sign up for the newsletter here: https://t.co/ZY4adCYUKG

name: TheAtlantic
text:
1/ Today, we’re introducing a new section devoted to climate change, Atlantic Planet.
https://t.co/JLGSoqH1Ln

name: TheAtlantic
text: In “The Dead Are Arising,” Kerri Greenidge writes, Les Payne sets Malcolm X’s “intellectual and political precocity alongside what many, like my grandmother, experienced as his disingenuousness.” https://t.co/Y9Qz9FzG8h

name: TheAtlantic
text: "When we consider how the postelection interregnum will go, we should remember that Trump had a vision of the presidency that began with extreme laziness, and that the end of his presidency could go roughly the same way," @gcaw writes: https://t.co/GvX11db6sK

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Poll work is hard, undercompensated, and uncelebrated, with a too-limited pool of recruits," @JudithShulevitz writes: https://t.co/LZtsVkxqCi

name: TheAtlantic
text: With each dismissive comment he makes about his own experience with COVID-19, Trump minimizes the suffering of an ever-growing share of Americans, @elainejgodfrey reports: https://t.co/wa7ArSFbNz

name: TheAtlantic
text: The evidence against gas stoves is damning—but they may be worse for you than for the environment, writes @aznfusion: https://t.co/j3bNtk8ai8

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @whitdangerfield: "All families experienced the cancellation of regular childhood events in the spring, yet for my daughter, this retraction of social life seemed particularly threatening," Pepper Stetler writes: https://t.co/qXXEp9wvwj

name: TheAtlantic
text: When wealth inequality is increasing and the spaces where humans can live comfortably are shrinking, the heat gap between rich and poor might be the world’s most daunting challenge, Vann R. Newkirk II writes: https://t.co/0xbFPLa8bW

name: TheAtlantic
text: Climate change is the one truly serious political problem facing all of us today, Lawrence Weschler writes. https://t.co/UwgaitKNMu

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @PaulBisceglio: I have so many good things to say about this. Welcome to Planet, The Atlantic's new home for climate-change coverage. 

Start with @yayitsrob's urgent and eloquent introduction: https://t.co/HPVmi8HMdM

Then more incredible stories are already waiting for you.

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: This, by Vann Newkirk II, is so important—and gives a name to a phenomenon that is already shaping so many people's lives: "The Heat Gap" is already here. https://t.co/qTNsitm8c8

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @slaskow: It should be obvious that *heat* is the defining issue of climate change, but somehow we overlook it. Vann Newkirk turned his eagle eye onto the inequality it will engender: "The heat gap between rich and poor might be the world’s most daunting challenge." https://t.co/ZMfKWkllr2

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @elcush: In a hot, unequal world, it’s instructive to think of the ability to exist comfortably outside as a natural resource, one that is growing ever scarcer. History has shown us how that story goes: https://t.co/Dtuy637gbW

name: TheAtlantic
text: Today, The Atlantic is launching Planet, a new section devoted to climate change. Read @yayitsrob on how our approach to climate will be different: https://t.co/I2UtsHNIjQ

name: TheAtlantic
text: Twitter has made real progress in becoming a safer and more useful site. Its choice to ban a poorly reported New York Post story undermines that work, @kait_tiffany writes. https://t.co/fva4hNYW6Y

name: TheAtlantic
text: “When you monetize power, when your politics no longer have room for empathy, things spin into an amoral chaos,” Luis Alberto Urrea writes. https://t.co/oMey4iEgoc

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @gcaw: Trump loses. What happens next?  Here’s one possible scenario, a fitting end to the Indolent Presidency:  https://t.co/cs1fnWKmsN (my latest in @TheAtlantic)

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @yayitsrob: 1/ Okay, this is a special one.

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @yayitsrob: 3/ Today, I’m thrilled to introduce Planet, The Atlantic’s new section devoted to climate change.

We want to be your source of stellar reporting, expert information, and thoughtful analysis about how to live at this moment.

https://t.co/riHYZwJs8w

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @yayitsrob: 4/ I’m also thrilled to announce THE WEEKLY PLANET, our new newsletter. 

It will be your guide to living through climate change, written and reported by me, every Tuesday morning.

Go, now, and subscribe here: https://t.co/5ivVQOgYpc https://t.co/jD0L95llQi

name: TheAtlantic
text: .@BarackObama plans to hit the campaign trail to support @JoeBiden in the final weeks before Election Day. But he's already reached millions of voters in ways that many observers have missed, reports @IsaacDovere: https://t.co/VPpCnQ5FSI

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Supreme Court is going to be conservative for a very long time—even as the Democratic coalition keeps growing, writes @RonBrownstein. https://t.co/UYvkWAtzh7

name: TheAtlantic
text: "When I sat down to watch 'Cuties,' I expected to disassociate or panic. Instead, I just felt wistful and a little sad." Caira Conner on watching Netflix's controversial coming-of-age film as a survivor of childhood sexual abuse. https://t.co/iLOpVmCk8i
